state.goal: Compile sindaring using ./scripts/build.sh then familiarise yourself with the language syntax, plan out loads of different scenarios for exploratory testing using as many combinations as you can. Do not compile or run the C output, there are issues with infinite loops that crash my computer. Analyse the C output for conformity, look for omissions or incorrectness in the transpilation, if you spot any infinite loops keep track. Document issues you find in ISSUES.md.

plan.goal: Compile sindaring using ./scripts/build.sh then familiarise yourself with the language syntax, plan out loads of different scenarios for exploratory testing using as many combinations as you can. Do not compile or run the C output, there are issues with infinite loops that crash my computer. Analyse the C output for conformity, look for omissions or incorrectness in the transpilation, if you spot any infinite loops keep track. Document issues you find in ISSUES.md.
plan.analysis: This task involves building the Sn compiler, understanding its syntax, creating comprehensive exploratory test cases, analyzing the transpiled C output for correctness issues, and documenting any problems found including potential infinite loops.

steps.description: Run ./scripts/build.sh to compile the Sn compiler and verify successful build
Read existing sample files and documentation to understand Sn language syntax and features
Explore the codebase to identify all supported language constructs (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, etc.)
Create exploratory test files covering basic expressions, arithmetic, string interpolation, and type coercion scenarios
Create exploratory test files covering control flow (if/else, while, for loops) and edge cases
Create exploratory test files covering functions, lambdas, closures, and recursion scenarios
Create exploratory test files covering complex combinations and edge cases (nested structures, chained operations)
Compile all exploratory test files to C output using the Sn compiler (without executing)
Analyze the generated C code for correctness, identify infinite loops, omissions, and transpilation errors
Document all discovered issues in ISSUES.md with detailed descriptions and examples

plan.raw:
ANALYSIS: This task involves building the Sn compiler, understanding its syntax, creating comprehensive exploratory test cases, analyzing the transpiled C output for correctness issues, and documenting any problems found including potential infinite loops.

PLAN:
1. Run ./scripts/build.sh to compile the Sn compiler and verify successful build | simple
2. Read existing sample files and documentation to understand Sn language syntax and features | simple
3. Explore the codebase to identify all supported language constructs (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, etc.) | medium
4. Create exploratory test files covering basic expressions, arithmetic, string interpolation, and type coercion scenarios | medium
5. Create exploratory test files covering control flow (if/else, while, for loops) and edge cases | medium
6. Create exploratory test files covering functions, lambdas, closures, and recursion scenarios | medium
7. Create exploratory test files covering complex combinations and edge cases (nested structures, chained operations) | medium
8. Compile all exploratory test files to C output using the Sn compiler (without executing) | simple
9. Analyze the generated C code for correctness, identify infinite loops, omissions, and transpilation errors | complex
10. Document all discovered issues in ISSUES.md with detailed descriptions and examples | medium

TOTAL_STEPS: 10
